name: Roasted Cauliflower with Pecorino and Mint
author: Amy Heilmann
summary: Cauliflower is first roasted over high heat with brown butter and salt before being tossed with Pecorino Romano cheese, red onions, mint, and lemon juice.
ingredients: 1 small head cauliflower, cut into florets
½ teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste
½ cup thinly sliced red onion
¼ cup finely grated Pecorino Romano cheese
10 leaves fresh mint, cut into thin strips
directions: Preheat the oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C)
Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat, whisking to ensure it doesn't burn, until light brown and nutty-smelling
Toss cauliflower florets with the brown butter and salt until well combined
Roast in the preheated oven until just tender, about 15 minutes
Remove and toss hot cauliflower with red onion, Pecorino Romano cheese, and mint
Drizzle with lemon juice and season with more salt to taste
